body.p:
R R Ironworks 23d July 1861
Phil Swigert Esqr
Dear Sir

We have ^had^ a home Guard organized at this place for about 6 weeks. We have made an attempt to procure arms from the Genl Goverment. but have as yet failed most of our men are poor but first rate & these hard times many of them cannot raise Means to pay for their uniform & Gun both. as the freights of on the Guns from the Government will cost $1.50 each. We have money to pay for uniform & music. I wish to know if we cannot get Guns from the State. If we organize according to the late law in regard to Home Guards -- There was 100 Guns I think Given to Genl Johnsons secession Co of Montgomery Co. He never paraded more than 25 or 30 men I understand that Company is about to disband It was raised under a secession flag. What chance would there be to get 50 of those Guns -- or some from Frankfort. There is a company at Stanton 4 1/2 miles from me that want guns. Home Guards good men If we could get Johnsons guns would do for both companies. The company at Stanton I wrote you about several days since marched last Saturday under a secession flag --

There has been in the last 3 or 4 days considerable stir amongst the secessionst in this neighborhood. on last Saturday two of them 1 from Paris. R Haws son & a man by the name of Cole from Winchester arrived in the neighborhood at 12 oclock at night & next morning early had conference with Some Secessiont & returned Sunday morning. I have had some hints that they expected to make an attack upon the arms in case any should be attempted to be carried through Ky for East Tennessee

I have a Son Geo M Jackson of Winchester. late Editor of the National Union. a paper published in that town who is now engaged in raising a company to Join Genl Rousus Regiment near Louisville or to go to Cumberland Gap if necessary. he has only been at it a week & has about 50 No 1 men & think he will make it from 80 to 100 this week. If not too busy will you please write me. I feel some interest to know where we are to get Guns. We have ^some^ desperate secessionist in our neighborhood & may have to use the guns at home
You might show this to Harry I Todd & other friends you might think proper

J. A. Jackson
Estill
Recd Kyans 25 July 1861.
